docs.title: Welcome to Lucas' Docs
docs.text:
Welcome to my documentation site!

This documentation site contain guides written by Lucas

I hope you find the guides on this site beneficial, I have written them to help me throughout my time working and learning. They range topics and levels of technicality; they have been written in a way for anyone with some technical skills to pick it up and replicate what I have done.

Check out the Guides section on the left

If you have any questions, comments or concerns, you can reach me here

Hope this helps!

-Lucas

docs.title: Steps to Create and Configure a Shared Folder
docs.text:
1. Create a Folder

  2. Set Security Permissions

    • Right-click the folder, select "Properties"
    • Go to the "Security" tab, then click "Advanced"
    • Disable inheritance
    • Apply and OK

  3. Edit Permissions

    • Remove the "Users" group
    • Add "Backup Operators" with full control
    • Apply and OK

  4. Configure Sharing

    • Go to the "Sharing" tab, select "Advanced Sharing"
    • Check "Share this folder"
    • Add $ at the end of the share name to make it hidden, replace spaces with underscores
    • Click "Permissions"
      • Remove "Everyone"
      • Add "Domain Users"

  5. Copy Share Path

    • Copy the share path: \\SERVERNAME\FOLDERNAME$

  6. Configure User Profile in Domain

    • Go to the user in the domain
    • In the "Profile" tab, connect H: to \\SERVERNAME\FOLDERNAME$\%username%
    • Apply and OK

  7. Create a Group in the Users Folder

    • In the "Members" tab, add the users (previously created in the user folder)
    • In the "Members of" tab, add "Domain Users"

  8. Configure Shared Group Folder

    • Create a folder
    • Go to "Advanced" and remove inheritance, then select "Convert inherited permissions into explicit permissions on this object"
    • Apply and OK
    • In the "Security" tab, add the group and give full permissions, remove users
    • Apply and OK
    • Go to the "Sharing" tab, select "Advanced Sharing"
    • Check "Share this folder"
    • In "Permissions," click "Add" and type the group name
    • Apply and OK
    • Give the added group full permissions

docs.title: Setting Up a Windows 11 PC with an Active Directory Domain Controller
Prerequisites
docs.text: • ADDC = Active Directory Domain Controller

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Login to Windows 11 PC

  2. Login to Domain Controller

  3. Find IP Addresses

    • Open Command Prompt and run ipconfig

  4. Set the DNS

    • Set the DNS to the IP of the AD DC (both ADDC and client)

  1. Open Active Directory Users and Computers

    • On the domain controller, press the Windows key
    • Search for and open "Windows Administrative Tools"
    • Select "Active Directory Users and Computers"

  2. Test Connection

    • Ping the IP address
    • Ping the ADDC NetBIOS name (e.g., mylab.test)

  3. Add Computer and User in ADDC

    • Add the computer
    • Add a user if needed

  4. Find Computer Name

    • Locate the computer name in "System"

  5. Join Client to Domain

    • On the client, check "Domain" and type in the domain name (e.g., mylab.test)

  6. Login with Administrator Account

    • In the login window, use the Administrator account
    • Since it is not part of the domain yet, add the domain in front of the username: mylab.test\Administrator

  7. Reboot

    • Reboot the computer to apply changes

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
• If you can ping the IPv4 address but it isn't finding the DNS name (mylab.test), try using IPv6.
    • Find the IPv6 address of the ADDC
    • Set the DNS of the client to the IPv6 address of the ADDC
    • Ping and retry

docs.title: Updating Dell iDRAC Using vFlash SD Card
Requirements
docs.text:
• Dell iDRAC vFlash SD Card
  • Dell Part Numbers: DP/N: 0583VN, 037D9D, T6NY4

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Download iDRAC Update:

  2. Download the iDRAC update for your machine. Ensure you download the .EXE file for Windows.

  3. Extract Update Files:

  4. Right-click the downloaded executable and choose "Extract to .../".

  5. Use 7zip or WinZip to extract the files into a new folder.

  6. Locate Firmware Image:

  7. In the extracted folder, locate another folder named "payload".

  8. Find the firmimg.d7 file within the "payload" folder.

  9. Prepare vFlash SD Card:

  10. Copy the firmimg.d7 file onto the Dell iDRAC vFlash SD card.

  11. Update Process:

  12. Power off your server.

  13. Insert the SD card containing firmimg.d7 into the iDRAC vFlash slot.

  14. Power On and Update:

  15. Power on the server and wait for approximately 5 minutes.
  16. The iDRAC should automatically detect the update file (firmimg.d7) on the vFlash SD card and proceed with the update.
  17. After completion, the iDRAC should be updated and responsive.

docs.title: Setting Up OpenVPN
docs.text: • Before you start you will need the OpenVPN Client Export plugin

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
Started from a clean start

  1. VPN Setup

    • OpenVPN

  2. Choose Wizard

    • Local User Access

  3. Create the CA

    • Give it a name

  4. Fill Out Details

    • Country code
    • State
    • City
    • Organization

  5. Create a New Certificate Server

    • Give it a name

  6. VPN Server Setup

    1. Interface: WAN
    2. Protocol: TCP IPv4 and IPv6 on all interfaces
    3. Add description
    4. Tunnel: Choose IP range not in network, used by VPN clients (e.g., 192.168.3.0/24)
    5. Check "redirect gateway"
    6. Local area: Put the local network (e.g., 192.168.0.1)
    7. Firewall rule: Check both "firewall rule" and "openvpn rule"
    8. Click finish

  7. Create User

    1. System -> User Manager
    2. Add
    3. Username
    4. Password
    5. Name
    6. CA: Use the one set up in the wizard

  8. Install Client Export Package

  9. Choose Interface IP Address

docs.title: Explanation of Settings
docs.text:
• Best Setting: TCP IPv4
  • Tunnel Network: Ensure this does not conflict with any other network (bridges the network)
  • Redirect Gateway: When connected, all traffic from client goes through VPN
  • Local Network: Put your local network (e.g., 192.168.0.1)
  • Add DNS Server 1: So users can access local resources
  • Add Rules

docs.title: Server Mode:
docs.text:
• Remote Access (SSL/TLS + User Auth): Individual installers per user
  • Remote Access (User Auth): One installer for all users, no per-client certificates

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: • Status / System Logs / System / General

docs.title: How to Update LSI 9211 to P20 or IT mode
Obtaining EFI Shell
docs.text:
1. Obtain EFI Shell:
  2. You will need to boot into an EFI shell. If your motherboard has it built-in, you can use that. Alternatively, you can download shell_full.efi here.
  3. Note: If the location changes, search for shell_full.efi on Tianocore's GitHub.

docs.title: Obtaining the Firmware
docs.text:
1. Download Firmware:
  2. Download the firmware from Broadcom's support site.
  3. Download:
    • 9201-16e_Package_P20_IT_FW_BIOS_for_MSDOS_WINDOWS
    • Installer_P20_for_UEFI
  4. Extract mptsas2.rom from \9201-16e_Package_P20_IT_FW_BIOS_for_MSDOS_Windows\sasbios_rel.
  5. Extract 9201-16e.bin from \Downloads\9201-16e_Package_P20_IT_FW_BIOS_for_MSDOS_Windows\Firmware\HBA_9201_16e_IT.
  6. Extract sas2flash.efi from \Installer_P20_for_UEFI\sas2flash_efi_ebc_rel.

docs.title: Preparing for the Upgrade
docs.text:
1. Prepare the Machine:
  2. Use a machine that allows booting from a file (e.g., Dell Server or Desktop).
  3. Place all necessary files on a USB stick in the root directory. If booting issues occur, place shell_full.efi in \efi\boot\shell_full.efi or \boot\efi\shell_full.efi.
  4. Files needed: shell_full.efi, 9201-16e.bin, mptsas2.rom, sas2flash.efi.
  5. Remove all other drives and cards.

docs.title: The Process
docs.text:
1. Boot and Flash the Firmware:

  2. Boot from file: shell_full.efi.

  3. Allow it to boot and then mount the flash drive: 

    > mount fs0
    It may appear as fs0 or fs1. 
    > fs0:
    Use whichever is appropriate (fs0 or fs1).

  4. Check if the card is recognized: 

    > sas2flash.efi -listall
    The card should be listed.

  5. Clean the card: 

    > sas2flash.efi -o -e 6
    Do not reboot after cleaning.

  6. Flash the firmware (replace 9201-16e.bin with your firmware version if different): 

    > sas2flash.efi -o -f 9201-16e.bin -b mptsas2.rom

  7. Verify the firmware update: 

    > sas2flash.efi -listall

  8. Exit the program: 

    > exit

  9. Verify Firmware Version:

  10. You should see the firmware version (e.g., 20.00.00) or the version you chose.

docs.title: How To Fix HUSMM1616ASS201 Inaccessible Sectors
Issue:
docs.text: When writing or reading to a HUSMM1616ASS201 drive, an error occurs saying “(sectors inaccessible 3028948992 to 3028951039)”.

docs.title: Solution:
docs.text: Instruct the drive that the last usable sector is before the inaccessible chunk of sectors in the drive. The inaccessible part of the drive is at the very end of the drive. When you set the last usable sector, you will not lose any usable space. After the solution is implemented, the OS will see the drive’s reported usable space as smaller. This is normal. You are making the drive not report that errored chunk, therefore it will not use it and cause errors. This guide will cover how to fix inaccessible sectors on HUSMM1616ASS201 SSDs on both Linux and Windows.

docs.title: Linux
docs.text:
Warning - Data Loss

These following commands will DESTROY any data on the drive. PLEASE backup any important data on the drive immediately.

Run the command to view the currently connected drives: 

`sudo sg_scan`

For example purposes, lets say the drive is /dev/sdx – please use the correct letter for your drive.

Warning

This command erases all the data on the drive, please verify that this is the affected drive!

sudo sg_format --format --size=512 /dev/sdx

After this command, please power cycle the drive by physically disconnecting it from the backplane. After it has been disconnected for 30 seconds, please reconnect the drive. Once the drive has been reconnected and recognized, please run sudo sg_scan this is to verify the drive is still the same letter. This next command sets the last useable sector right before the errored chunk.

sudo sg_format --resize - -count=3028948982 /dev/sdx

please power cycle the drive once more. to verify that the command has worked, you can issue the following command

sudo sg_readcap -a /dev/sdx

You should now see the number of logical blocks: 3028948982 if so, you have done it correctly and your drive is ready to be used.

docs.title: Windows:
docs.text:
This works for Windows 10, Windows Server 16 and 19. First navigate to sg3 utils Alternatively, google “sg3_utils” and it should be the first link, you will find it.

Then go to “Download and Build” and scroll about half way down the page to find the Windows Zip packages.

Download the appropriate zip for your system. Locate your download then extract it to a folder. Open a command prompt with administrator access.

Change directory of the command prompt to the “exes” folder inside of the unzipped sg3_utils folder

cd C:\Users\admin\Downloads\sg3_utils-1.45mgw64/exes

From here you can run the first command to see connected drives:

sg_scan

you should see your drive listed as a physical disk: PD for this example, I will refer to it as PD9 – you should use the correct number for your drive. you can check the drives stats with sg_readcap PD9

Warning - Data Loss

These following commands will DESTROY any data on the drive, PLEASE backup any important data on the drive immediately

run the command to view the currently connected drives: sg_scan

For example purposes, let’s say the drive is PD9 – you should use the correct number for your drive.

Warning

This command erases all the data on the drive, please verify that this is the affected drive.

sg_format - -format - -size=512 PD9

After this command, please power cycle the drive by physically disconnecting it from the backplane. After it has been disconnected for 30 seconds, please reconnect the drive. Once the drive has been reconnected and recognized, please run sg_scan This is to verify the drive is still the same letter.

This next command sets the last useable sector right before the errored chunk.

sg_format - -resize - -count=3028948982 PD9

Please power cycle the drive once more. To verify that the command has worked, you can issue the following command

sg_readcap -a PD9

You should now see the number of logical blocks: 3028948982 If so, you have done it correctly and your drive is ready to be used.
